page.title: 14RECREATION - Hall activities
page.content: Two users of the village hall are the Play Group and the Womens' Institute. The WI meets monthly usually with a guest speaker and there is usually a craft competition with a prize for the best product. Membership costs Â£3.50 annually with extra paid for outings. The WI usually produce the annual village play for which the audience pays to watch. The WI is a good thing for the local woman. The play group is for ages 3 to 5 years. It meets five mornings a week from 9.15am to 11.45am; it costs Â£1 per child per morning. Four adults look after the children who play games, have stories read to them and drink a glass of milk and eat a biscuit. At Christmas the children act a play for their parents to see.
